The Parliament met at 9.30 a.m., MR. DEPUTY SPEAKER [THE HON. (DR.) RIZVIE
ESTABLISHMENT OF PARLIAMENTARY CAUCUS ON ARTS

( ) (The Hon. Deputy Speaker) I wish to inform that establishment of the Parliamentary Caucus on Arts and Cultural Affairs was approved by the Committee on Parliamentary Business at its Meeting held on 05th June, 2025 and accordingly, the inaugural meeting of the Caucus will be held on Friday, 11th of July, 2025, that is, today, at 11.00 a.m. in Committee Room No. 02. I kindly invite the Hon. Members of Parliament who are interested in this regard to participate in that meeting.
AWARENESS WORKSHOP ON THE ACTIVITIES OF THE RED
CROSS AND RED CRESCENT MOVEMENT IN SRI LANKA
( ) (The Hon. Deputy Speaker) I wish to inform that an awareness workshop on "The Activities of the Red Cross and Red Crescent Movement

in Sri Lanka" for the Hon. Members of Parliament conducted by the Sri Lanka Red Cross Society will be held today, 11th July, 2025, at 2.00 p.m. in Committee Room No. 1 of Parliament. All the Members of Parliament are kindly requested to participate in the workshop.
( ) (The Hon. Deputy Speaker) On behalf of the Hon. Speaker, I present the-

Eleventh Volume - Part 02 of the Triennial Report of the Auditor-General on Corporations, Boards and Bureaus;

in terms of Section 14 of the National Audit Act, No. 19 of 2018 received to the National Audit Office, in terms of Article 154(6) of the Constitution of the Democratic Socialist Republic of Sri Lanka.

( ) (The Hon. Deputy Speaker) Question No. 1 - 14/2024 - (1), the Hon. Hesha Withanage Ankumbura Arachchi. - [Not in the Chamber.]
asked the Prime Minister and Minister of Education, Higher Education and Vocational Education:
(a) Will she inform this House the -
(i) number of Commissions appointed so far to investigate the Easter Sunday attack that took place in Sri Lanka;
(ii) names of the members appointed to each of the Commissions concerned, separately;
(iii) recommendations made by each of those Commissions, separately; and
(iv) measures that have been taken so far to implement those recommendations?
( ) (The Hon. Deputy Speaker) Hon. Member, would you move on to your second Supplementary Question? .

SRI LANKA INSTITUTE OF INFORMATION TECHNOLOGY:
() , ? asked the Minister of Trade, Commerce, Food Security and Co-operative Development:
(i) whether the then Ministry of Trade has invested money in the establishment of the Sri Lanka Institute of Information Technology (SLIIT);
(ii) if so, the amount of money that has thus been invested;
(iii) the number of students studying in the institution concerned at present;
(iv) the number of students who studied in the institution in each of the years from the year 2020 to 2024, separately;
(v) if there is any decline in that institution at present, the steps that have been taken to prevent it; and
(vi) the legal action that has been taken against the management of that institution, who is responsible for bringing that institution down to a loss-making position?
( ) ( - , , ) (The Hon. Wasantha Samarasinghe - Minister of Trade, Commerce, Food Security and Cooperative Development) SLIIT . . . .

REGIONAL HOSPITALS IN VAVUNIYA, MANNAR AND
asked the Minister of Health and Mass Media:
(i) the number of employees required to be in the cadre of a government regional hospital, separately in respect of each position;
(ii) the number of government regional hospitals situated in Vavuniya, Mannar and Mullaitivu Districts, separately in respect of each district;
(iii) the names of the hospitals referred to above;
(iv) whether nurses who have received permanent appointments in the aforesaid hospitals are currently serving in the hospitals concerned;
(v) if not, the reasons for that; and
(vi) the solutions that will be provided regarding that?
(b) Will he also inform this House -
(i) whether the Puthukudiyiruppu Regional Hospital of the Mullaitivu District has been upgraded to a base hospital;
(ii) if so, the date of the upgrade; and

(iii) the number of employees approved for the aforesaid hospital as per the classification of the hospital and, of the number of employees currently serving there, separately in respect of each position?

amount of aluminium by the Government to meet the demand of aluminium industrialists in Sri Lanka;
(ii) the measures that will be taken against the
export of aluminium as fake value-added products; and
(iii) the measures that will be taken to protect

asked the Minister of Agriculture, Livestock, Land and Irrigation:

(a) Will he inform this House - (i) whether he is aware that thousands of acres of paddy fields in the Samanthurai and Nintavur areas get submerged when the Thoppikuda major canal on the Southern Bank Main Canal maintained by the Samanthurai Irrigation Office of the Irrigation Department, overflows; (ii) whether the Irrigation Department has allocated financial provisions necessary for the permanent reconstruction of the canal referred to above; (iii) if so, the amount of the financial provision concerned; and (iv) the time needed for completing the reconstruction work of the canal concerned?
() ( ) ( () - ) (The Hon. (Dr.) Susil Ranasinghe - Deputy Minister of Land and Irrigation) .

MINIMIZATION OF TRAFFIC CONGESTION IN COLOMBO AND
) ( - ) (The Hon. Gayantha Karunathilleka on behalf of the Hon. Hesha Withanage Ankumbura Arachchi ) - (1):
() , ? asked the Minister of Transport, Highways, Ports and Civil Aviation:
(i) the number of projects implemented from 2015 up to now in order to minimize the traffic congestion in Colombo and its suburbs;
(ii) the names of the aforesaid projects;
(iii) the amount of money spent on each of the projects concerned, separately;
(iv) whether he is aware that the Audit Report has pointed out that the said projects have failed by now, and this has entailed a waste of money;
(v) if so, the amount of money that has been wasted, as is mentioned above; and
(vi) the further action that will be taken regarding the projects referred to above?
() ( ) ( () - ) (The Hon. (Dr.) Prasanna Gunasena - Deputy Minister of Transport and Highways) * .
) ( - ) (The Hon. Mayilvaganam Jegatheeswaran on behalf of the Hon. Danushka Ranganath) - (1):
asked the Minister of Finance, Planning and Economic Development:
(i) the total number of Aswesuma beneficiaries in the Kalutara District;
(ii) the aforesaid number of beneficiaries in terms of the Aswesuma beneficiary categorization, separately;
(iii) the number of Aswesuma beneficiaries in each of the constituencies of the Kalutara District, separately;
(iv) whether he is aware of the families residing in the Agalawatta Electorate who deserve the Aswesuma benefit, but have not received it yet; and
(v) whether some relief programme will be implemented in future for them?
(b) Will he also inform this House -
(i) whether there is a standard criterion for selecting low-income earners;
(ii) whether he is satisfied with the methodology that has been adopted in selecting the Aswesuma beneficiaries; and
(iii) if not, the reasons for it?
) ( - ... ) (The Hon. Gayantha Karunathilleka on behalf of the Hon. W.H.M. Dharmasena) - (2):
() , ? asked the Minister of Agriculture, Livestock, Land and Irrigation:
(i) the total extent of paddy lands existing in the Monaragala District;
(ii) the total paddy harvest of that district in the Maha season of 2024/2025;
(iii) whether fertilizer subsidy had been given to all paddy farmers in the Monaragala District prior to harvesting;
(iv) the quantity of paddy purchased by the Paddy Marketing Board, out of the paddy harvest referred to above; and
(v) the number of State-owned paddy warehouses located in the Monaragala District, and the address and storage capacity of each of those warehouses, separately?
( ) ( - ) (The Hon. Namal Karunaratne - Deputy Minister of Agriculture and Livestock) * .
COLOMBO-BATTICALOA NIGHT MAIL TRAIN: REINTRODUCTION OF FIRST-CLASS SLEEPING BERTHS
asked the Minister of Transport, Highways, Ports and Civil Aviation:
(i) whether he is aware that the Colombo-Batticaloa night mail train no longer provides first-class sleeping berth facility;
(ii) if so, the reasons for the unavailability of this facility;
(iii) whether this facility will be reintroduced; and
(iv) if not, the reasons for it?
(b) Will he also inform this House -

(i) whether he is aware that the price of a ticket for the first-class sleeping berth (non-air-conditioned) on the Colombo-Batticoloa night mail train was Rs. 5,000, whereas the price of a ticket for a first-class sleeping berth (with air-conditioned facilities) on other routes is approximately Rs. 2,800;
(ii) the rationale behind this price difference; and
(iii) the reasons for such an apparent discriminatory treatment?
( ) (The Hon. Deputy Speaker) Question under Standing Order 27(2), the Hon. K. Kader Masthan.

( ) (The Hon. Deputy Speaker) Hon. Dayasiri Jayasekara, the other day, your matter of Privilege was referred to the Acting IGP for his opinion and he has written to the Secretary-General of Parliament, stating that your summons to make a statement was based on a statement you had made outside the House and not on something spoken inside the House. Therefore, I believe that matter of Privilege cannot be entertained and the Secretary-General of Parliament will write to you with regard to that.
( ) (The Hon. Dayasiri Jayasekara, Attorney-at-Law) Hon. Deputy Speaker, please give me one minute. ( ) (The Hon. Deputy Speaker) Yes, Hon. Member.

( ) (The Hon. Dayasiri Jayasekara, Attorney-at-Law) Hon. Deputy Speaker, if you read my whole Question of Privilege, you would see that I have raised some questions about all the other MPs as well. The Hon. (Dr.) Ramanathan Archchuna also has an issue because he had said something in Parliament and he had been summoned and questioned. This is wrong and they cannot do that. - - .

( ) (The Hon. Deputy Speaker) Hon. Dayasiri Jayasekara, I get your point. I think the Acting IGP has written to the Secretary-General of Parliament mentioning the issues of the other Hon. Members of Parliament as well. You will get a copy of it from the Secretary-General.
( ) (The Hon. Dayasiri Jayasekara, Attorney-at-Law) So, what will happen to Hon. (Dr.) Ramanathan Archchuna?
( ) (The Hon. Deputy Speaker) His issue and the issues of the other Hon. Members are also mentioned in the letter.

() ( () ) (The Hon. (Dr.) Ramanathan Archchuna) Sir, I rise to a point of Order. ( ) (The Hon. Deputy Speaker) Hon. Member, shall we move on? I know that your point of Order relates to the same concern. The Secretary-General of Parliament will write to you with regard to your Privilege matter also.
() ( () ) (The Hon. (Dr.) Ramanathan Archchuna) Hon. Deputy Speaker, please give me 10 seconds. ( ) (The Hon. Deputy Speaker) What have you got to say in 10 seconds?

() ( () ) (The Hon. (Dr.) Ramanathan Archchuna) Sir, please count the 10 seconds. Sir, you said that the Hon. Dayasiri Jayasekara had been summoned because he had said something outside Parliament. But, I have never spoken a single word outside Parliament. Where does this Parliament go? The Speaker has given a letter to me and nothing had been mentioned in that letter about the 323 containers. That statement was taken based on my speech in Parliament. This is a joke! Parliament has become a joke, Sir!

( ) (The Hon. Deputy Speaker) Notice of Motions and Orders of the Day. At the commencement of Private Members' Motions, I wish to inform the House that the Hon. Hesha Withanage Ankumbura Arachchi, the Hon. Lal Premanath and the Hon. T.K. Jayasundara have informed in writing of their inability to attend today's Proceedings due to unavoidable circumstances.
Accordingly, Item No. 1 - P.3/2024, Item No. 5 - P.39/2025 and Item No. 6 - P.40/2025 - in today's Order Paper will be deferred to a future date.
Item No. 2 - P.14/2024 - to be moved by the Hon. Rohana Bandara. You have 10 minutes.
